description:
Language object. The language object is global and it can't be set on each chart initialization. Instead, use Highcharts.setOptions to set it before any chart is initialized.

Highcharts.setOptions({
    lang: {
        months: [
            'Janvier', 'Février', 'Mars', 'Avril',
            'Mai', 'Juin', 'Juillet', 'Août',
            'Septembre', 'Octobre', 'Novembre', 'Décembre'
        ],
        weekdays: [
            'Dimanche', 'Lundi', 'Mardi', 'Mercredi',
            'Jeudi', 'Vendredi', 'Samedi'
        ]
    }
});

children.name: accessibility
children.description:
Configure the accessibility strings in the chart. Requires the accessibility module to be loaded. For a description of the module and information on its features, see Highcharts Accessibility.

For more dynamic control over the accessibility functionality, see accessibility.pointDescriptionFormatter, accessibility.seriesDescriptionFormatter, and accessibility.screenReaderSectionFormatter.

children.name: contextButtonTitle
children.description: Exporting module menu. The tooltip title for the context menu holding print and export menu items.

children.name: decimalPoint
children.description: The default decimal point used in the Highcharts.numberFormat method unless otherwise specified in the function arguments.

children.name: downloadCSV
children.description: The text for the menu item.

children.name: downloadJPEG
children.description: Exporting module only. The text for the JPEG download menu item.

children.name: downloadPDF
children.description: Exporting module only. The text for the PDF download menu item.

children.name: downloadPNG
children.description: Exporting module only. The text for the PNG download menu item.

children.name: downloadSVG
children.description: Exporting module only. The text for the SVG download menu item.

children.name: downloadXLS
children.description: The text for the menu item.

children.name: drillUpText
children.description: The text for the button that appears when drilling down, linking back to the parent series. The parent series' name is inserted for {series.name}.

children.name: exitFullscreen
children.description: Exporting module only. The text for the menu item to exit the chart from full screen.

children.name: exportData
children.description: The text for exported table.

children.name: hideData
children.description: The text for the menu item.

children.name: loading
children.description: The loading text that appears when the chart is set into the loading state following a call to chart.showLoading.

children.name: months
children.description: An array containing the months names. Corresponds to the %B format in Highcharts.dateFormat().

children.name: numericSymbolMagnitude
children.description: The magnitude of numericSymbols replacements. Use 10000 for Japanese, Korean and various Chinese locales, which use symbols for 10^4, 10^8 and 10^12.

children.name: numericSymbols
children.description: Metric prefixes used to shorten high numbers in axis labels. Replacing any of the positions with null causes the full number to be written. Setting numericSymbols to null disables shortening altogether.

children.name: printChart
children.description: Exporting module only. The text for the menu item to print the chart.

children.name: resetZoom
children.description: The text for the label appearing when a chart is zoomed.

children.name: resetZoomTitle
children.description: The tooltip title for the label appearing when a chart is zoomed.

children.name: shortMonths
children.description: An array containing the months names in abbreviated form. Corresponds to the %b format in Highcharts.dateFormat().

children.name: shortWeekdays
children.description: Short week days, starting Sunday. If not specified, Highcharts uses the first three letters of the lang.weekdays option.

children.name: thousandsSep
children.description: The default thousands separator used in the Highcharts.numberFormat method unless otherwise specified in the function arguments. Defaults to a single space character, which is recommended in ISO 31-0 and works across Anglo-American and continental European languages.

children.name: viewData
children.description: The text for the menu item.

children.name: viewFullscreen
children.description: Exporting module only. The text for the menu item to view the chart in full screen.

children.name: weekdays
children.description: An array containing the weekday names.

children.name: zoomIn
children.description: The title appearing on hovering the zoom in button. The text itself defaults to "+" and can be changed in the button options.

children.name: zoomOut
children.description: The title appearing on hovering the zoom out button. The text itself defaults to "-" and can be changed in the button options.
